Package org.neo4j.storageengine.api

Interface TransactionIdStore

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MetadataProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MetaDataStore, ReadOnlyTransactionIdStore
    public interface TransactionIdStore
    Keeps a latest transaction id. There's one counter for committed transaction id and one for closed transaction id. The committed transaction id is for writing into a log before making the changes to be made. After that the application of those transactions might be asynchronous and completion of those are marked using transactionClosed(long, long, long, PageCursorTracer).

    A transaction ID passes through a TransactionIdStore like this:

    1. nextCommittingTransactionId() is called and an id is returned to a committer. At this point that id isn't visible from any getter.
    2. transactionCommitted(long, int, long, PageCursorTracer) is called with this id after the fact that the transaction has been committed, i.e. written forcefully to a log. After this call the id may be visible from getLastCommittedTransactionId() if all ids before it have also been committed.
    3. transactionClosed(long, long, long, PageCursorTracer) is called with this id again, this time after all changes the transaction imposes have been applied to the store.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int BASE_TX_CHECKSUM  
      static long BASE_TX_COMMIT_TIMESTAMP
      Timestamp value used initially for an empty database.
      static long BASE_TX_ID
      Tx id counting starting from this value (this value means no transaction ever committed).
      static int UNKNOWN_TX_CHECKSUM
      CONSTANT FOR UNKNOWN TX CHECKSUM
      static long UNKNOWN_TX_COMMIT_TIMESTAMP
      Timestamp value used when record in the metadata store is not present and there are no transactions in logs.

    • Field Detail

      • BASE_TX_ID

        static final long BASE_TX_ID
        Tx id counting starting from this value (this value means no transaction ever committed). Note that a read only transaction will get txId = 0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BASE_TX_CHECKSUM

        static final int BASE_TX_CHECKSUM
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • nextCommittingTransactionId

        long nextCommittingTransactionId()
        Returns:
        the next transaction id for a committing transaction. The transaction id is incremented with each call. Ids returned from this method will not be visible from getLastCommittedTransactionId() until handed to transactionCommitted(long, int, long, PageCursorTracer).

      • committingTransactionId

        long committingTransactionId()
        Returns:
        the transaction id of last committing transaction.

      • transactionCommitted

        void transactionCommitted​(long transactionId,
                          int checksum,
                          long commitTimestamp,
                          PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Signals that a transaction with the given transaction id has been committed (i.e. appended to a log). Calls to this method may come in out-of-transaction-id order. The highest transaction id seen given to this method will be visible in getLastCommittedTransactionId().
        Parameters:
        transactionId - the applied transaction id.
        checksum - checksum of the transaction.
        commitTimestamp - the timestamp of the transaction commit.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer

      • getLastCommittedTransactionId

        long getLastCommittedTransactionId()
        Returns:
        highest seen transactionCommitted(long, int, long, PageCursorTracer) committed transaction id}.

      • getLastCommittedTransaction

        TransactionId getLastCommittedTransaction()
        Returns transaction information about the highest committed transaction, i.e. transaction id as well as checksum.
        Returns:
        TransactionId describing the last (i.e. highest) committed transaction.

      • getUpgradeTransaction

        TransactionId getUpgradeTransaction()
        Returns transaction information about transaction where the last upgrade was performed, i.e. transaction id as well as checksum.
        Returns:
        TransactionId describing the most recent upgrade transaction.

      • getLastClosedTransactionId

        long getLastClosedTransactionId()
        Returns:
        highest seen gap-free transactionClosed(long, long, long, PageCursorTracer) closed transaction id}.

      • getLastClosedTransaction

        long[] getLastClosedTransaction()
        Returns transaction information about the last committed transaction, i.e. transaction id as well as the log position following the commit entry in the transaction log.
        Returns:
        transaction information about the last closed (highest gap-free) transaction. 
         [0]: transaction id
 [1]: log version
 [2]: byte offset into that log version

      • setLastCommittedAndClosedTransactionId

        void setLastCommittedAndClosedTransactionId​(long transactionId,
                                            int checksum,
                                            long commitTimestamp,
                                            long byteOffset,
                                            long logVersion,
                                            PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Used by recovery, where last committed/closed transaction ids are set. Perhaps this shouldn't be exposed like this?
        Parameters:
        transactionId - transaction id that will be the last closed/committed id.
        checksum - checksum of the transaction.
        commitTimestamp - the timestamp of the transaction commit.
        byteOffset - offset in the log file where the committed entry has been written.
        logVersion - version of log the committed entry has been written into.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer.

      • transactionClosed

        void transactionClosed​(long transactionId,
                       long logVersion,
                       long byteOffset,
                       PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Signals that a transaction with the given transaction id has been fully applied. Calls to this method may come in out-of-transaction-id order.
        Parameters:
        transactionId - the applied transaction id.
        logVersion - version of log the committed entry has been written into.
        byteOffset - offset in the log file where start writing the next log entry.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer

      • resetLastClosedTransaction

        void resetLastClosedTransaction​(long transactionId,
                                long logVersion,
                                long byteOffset,
                                boolean missingLogs,
                                PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Unconditionally set last closed transaction info. Should be used for cases where last closed transaction info should be set or overwritten.
        Parameters:
        transactionId - new last closed transaction id.
        logVersion - new last closed transaction log version
        byteOffset - new last closed transaction offset
        missingLogs - flag to record missing logs date
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer

      • flush

        void flush​(PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Forces the transaction id counters to persistent storage.
